Relevant Projects

Classical Mechanics

Python/Numpy/Matplotlib, Differential Equations

Calculated projectory of a cannonball (to shoot down a plane) by solving/simplifying second order differential equations for the x and y positions of the cannonball with air resistance taken into account.

Methods Used: 4th order Runge-Kutta Method to solve the first order differential equations.

View

Ignorant Monty Hall

Python/Numpy, Conditional Probabilities

Simulated a modified version of the Monty Hall Problem, where the host doesn't know where the prize is. By not knowing this fact, it affects the probability of the contestant winning the prize as shown in the simulation.

Methods Used: Conditional Probabilities, Bayes' Theorem

View

Monte Carlo Method

Python/Numpy/Matplotlib, Monte Carlo Methods

Simulated a higher order dimensional graph. The volume would be impossible to find without advanced knowledge of multivariable calculus, but using the Monte-Carlo Method and random sampling, it was solved in seconds.

Methods Used: Monte-Carlo Methods, Random Sampling

View

Matrix and Electricity

Python/Numpy, Linear Algebra

Used Ohm's law and Kirchoff's laws to simplify the problem into a set of linear algebra eqautions. Then, using LU decomposition, the eigenvalues/vectors had been found and used to generalize the problem to predict the voltage in a system of N resistors.

Methods Used: Linear Algebra, LU Decopmsition, Banded Matrix

View

Lotka-Volterra Eq.

Python/Numpy/Matplotlib, Regression

Lotka-Volterra Equations show the mathematical model between the interactions between predator and prey in the environment. By solving the L-V Equations, a predictive model of rabbit and fox population had been produced over a time period.

Methods Used: 4th order Runge-Kutta Method to solve the first order differential equations, Regression

View

Vue.js Sorting

Javascript (Vue.js), HTML, CSS

Used Vue.js, HTML, and CSS to program a sorting algorithm visualizer. Different options are available in the control menu, and can be used to randomize, or choose different sorting algorithms to visualize.

Methods Used: Merge Sort, Bubble Sort, Quick Sort, Randomization

View
